title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: the distant hills above Glen Isla and Cairn Lochan (Lord Airlle's " Country "), it was even more beautiful  ; for, as the day advanced, the mountains became clearer and clearer, of a lovely blue, Y/hile the valleys were in shadow.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: Beyond Glen Isla were seen the Lomond Hills behind Kinross, at the foot of which is Loch Leven.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: We had then to take a somewhat circuitous route in order to avoid some bogs, and to come to a spot where we looked right up the valley for an immense  distance ; to the left, or rather more to the south, was Glen Isla, another glen, but wider, and not with the same high mountains as Cairn Lochan.
